ext_descriptions.ext_description: A certification_item type is an extensible list of alternate entity data types. It provides a mechanism to refer to instances of the data types included in the types that extend the certification_item type. This empty extensible select type requires extension in a further module, to ensure that any entity data type that refers to it can have a valid instantiation.

A Certification is a certificate. It asserts satisfaction of particular quality criteria.
Certification information can be attached to any aspect of product or activity data.

the word or group of words by which the Certification is known. 'AP 214 certified' is an example of name that can be used to indicate a certification of a STEP interface. 'ISO 9000' is an example of name that can be used to indicate that a product has been developed following ISO 9000 directives.

the text that defines the type of Certification that is applied. 'Conformance to ISO 10303-214' is an example of certification type, suitable for software products dedicated to data exchanges. 'Quality Insurance' is an example of certification type, suitable to assess that products have been developped and manufactured with auditable quality criteria.
the text that provides further information about the Certification. The value of the attribute need not be specified.

A Certification_assignment is an association of a Certification with activity or product data.
'certified supplier' is an example of certification that may be granted to an organization by its contractor.
the Certification that is assigned to activity or product data.

the text that specifies the purpose of the association of the Certification with respect to the product or activity data it is granted to. 'Software acceptance' is an example of role that can be used to track the fact that an external product has been inspected before having been made available in an organization.
the activity or product data to which the Certification is assigned.
